components::​broadcaster
sp_base_component
components::​ .​broadcaster​#(type T=uvm_object)

A utility component providing broadcast facilities.

Simply call add_provider() to register a uvm_component as a provider of the broadcaster, and add_subscriber() to register any uvm_component as a subscriber of the broadcaster.

Any items sent to the broadcaster by its providers will be broadcasted in order to any subscriber, allowing one to many, many to one, and many to many connections.

Types
uvm_port_t
typedef uvm_port_base#(
uvm_tlm_if_base
#(
T, T)
) uvm_port_t

Typedef for the base uvm port class <uvm_port_base> with parameters fitting to the broadcaster's item type parameter.

Broadcast API
mute
virtual function void mute()

Mutes this broadcaster instance.

muted
virtual function bit muted()

Returns 1 if broadcast is muted or 0 otherwise.

unmute
virtual function void unmute()

Unmutes this broadcaster instance.

write
virtual function void write(
T 
_item
)

Write a broadcast item to the broadcaster's fifo.

Written items are broadcasted in-order during UVM run phase.

broadcast
virtual function void broadcast(
ref 
T 
_item,
input 
bit 
_call_pre_post
 = 
1
)

Broadcast an item through the <broadcast_port>.

if _call_pre_post is set to 1, pre_broadcast and post_broadcast will be called before and after writing the item to the <broadcast_port>.

if _call_pre_post is set to 0, the calls to pre_broadcast and post_broadcast are skipped.

Provider-Subscriber API
providers
virtual function uvm_port_list providers()

Returns a list of providers registered to provide items to this broadcaster instance.

subscribers
virtual function uvm_port_list subscribers()

Returns a list of subscribers registered to receive items from this broadcaster instance.

num_providers
virtual function int num_providers()

Returns the number of providers registered to provide items to this broadcaster instance.

num_subscribers
virtual function int num_subscribers()

Returns the number of providers registered to receive items from this broadcaster instance.

provide_to
virtual function void provide_to(
uvm_port_t 
_subscriber
)

Registers _subscriber as a subscriber of this broadcaster instance and appends it to this broadcaster's subscribers list.

subscribe_to
virtual function void subscribe_to(
uvm_port_t 
_provider
)

Registers _provider as a provider to this broadcaster instance and appends it to this broadcaster's providers list.

add_provider
virtual function void add_provider(
uvm_port_t 
_provider
)

Synonym for subscribe_to.

add_subscriber
virtual function void add_subscriber(
uvm_port_t 
_subscriber
)

Synonym for provide_to.

User Definable Hooks
pre_broadcast
virtual function void pre_broadcast(
ref 
T 
_broadcast
)

User-definable hook method that is called right after an item was popped from the fifo, and before the call to is_item_valid is made.

A user may modify the and perform any operations required on the broadcast item before it will be determined that it should be skipped/broadcasted by the proceeding logic.

post_broadcast
virtual function void post_broadcast(
ref 
T 
_broadcast
)

Default implementation of user-definable hook called after an item has been broadcasted.

This may be overriden by subclass incase a subclass broadcaster implements some sort of states that requires updating after every broadcast for example.

is_item_valid
virtual function bit is_item_valid(
ref 
T 
_broadcast
)

Default implementation of user-definable hook which tells the broadcaster instance whether or not a broadcast item should be skipped instead of being broadcasted.

The current default implementation simply assures that the item is not null, but a user may extend this method to perform additional checks if needed.
